page.title: 18MILL WORKER'S DAY
page.content: A TYPICAL DAY FOR A {MILL WORKER } WOULD BEGIN AT 8a.m. AND END AT 5 p.m. THERE WOULD BE A BREAK OF 10 MINUTES AT 10a.m. AND A LUNCH BREAK OF 1 HOUR. THE AVERAGE WORKER WILL WORK A 5_DAY OR 40_HOUR WEEK,DEPENDING UPON WHICH SHIFTS HE OR SHE WORKS.THE WORKER MAY BE INVOLVED IN ONE OF THE FOLLOWING JOBS_DYEING,WINDING,WEAVING OR DARNING. {WINDING}INVOLVES WINDING THE YARN FROM LARGE CONES ONTO SMALLER ONES TO BE USED FOR WEAVING OR SENT TO BE DYED. } {WEAVING }IS NOW DONE ON VERY FAST RAPIER LOOMS. {DARNING}IS DONE AFTER THE CLOTH IS WOVEN.THE DARNER HAS TO FIND ANY FAULTS OR BROKEN YARNS IN THE PIECE OF CLOTH AND MEND THEM.THEN THE PIECE OF CLOTH WILL BE WASHED AND CHECKED AGAIN TO MAKE SURE IT IS FAULTLESS.
